headline: Boeing, GE Aerospace Get Qatar Airways Order After Saudi AI Tech Deals
summary: Boeing  and  GE Aerospace  received a $96 billion order from Qatar Airways as President Trump looks to boost investments in defense and aircraft in the Middle East after reaching artificial intelligence and tech agreements on Tuesday.  The order, announced Wednesday, includes up to 210 American-made Boeing 787 Dreamliners and 777X aircraft and more than 400 GEnx and GE9X engines from GE Aerospace.  In separate releases, the companies said the agreement marks Boeing’s largest orders for widebody and 787 models to date, GE Aerospace’s biggest widebody engine order and Qatar Airway’s largest aircraft order in its history.

raw.headline: Boeing, GE Aerospace Get Qatar Airways Order After Saudi AI Tech Deals
raw.summary: Boeing  and  GE Aerospace  received a $96 billion order from Qatar Airways as President Trump looks to boost investments in defense and aircraft in the Middle East after reaching artificial intelligence and tech agreements on Tuesday.  The order, announced Wednesday, includes up to 210 American-made Boeing 787 Dreamliners and 777X aircraft and more than 400 GEnx and GE9X engines from GE Aerospace.  In separate releases, the companies said the agreement marks Boeing’s largest orders for widebody and 787 models to date, GE Aerospace’s biggest widebody engine order and Qatar Airway’s largest aircraft order in its history.

headline: Why Uber-Backed Aurora Innovation Stock Sank Today
summary: Uber announced it plans to issue notes exchangeable for Aurora stock.  Shares of Aurora Innovation (NASDAQ: AUR) tumbled 6.3% on Wednesday.  The autonomous vehicle technology company's stock had been down as much as 17% earlier in the day.

headline: Uber and iFood announce strategic partnership in Brazil
summary: SAO PAULO (Reuters) -Uber Technologies Inc and iFood, a Brazilian food delivery app, on Wednesday announced a strategic partnership in Brazil, where delivery and ride-hailing services have grown rapidly in recent years.  Under the collaboration, iFood users will be able to book Uber rides directly from the iFood app, while Uber users will gain access to iFood’s food, grocery, pharmacy and convenience delivery services within the Uber app.

raw.headline: Uber and iFood announce strategic partnership in Brazil
raw.summary: SAO PAULO (Reuters) -Uber Technologies Inc and iFood, a Brazilian food delivery app, on Wednesday announced a strategic partnership in Brazil, where delivery and ride-hailing services have grown rapidly in recent years. headline: Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER) Announces US$1 Billion Exchangeable Senior Notes Due 2028
summary: Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER) recently announced the pricing of $1 billion in 0% exchangeable senior notes due 2028, highlighting its proactive approach to manage its capital structure, which could have drawn positive investor sentiment. Coupled with its strong first-quarter earnings report, which showed substantial growth in sales and a turnaround to profitability, the company's stock price rose 27% over the last month. headline: Uber to introduce fixed-route shuttles in major US cities designed for commuters
summary: Ride-hail and delivery giant Uber is introducing cheap, fixed-route rides along busy corridors during weekday commute hours in major U.S. cities -- one solution to a world that feels, for most people, more expensive every day. Starting Wednesday, riders in Baltimore, Boston, Chicago, Dallas, New York City, Philadelphia, and San Francisco will be able to save 50% off the price of an UberX trip by booking with Uber’s new “Route Share” feature. headline: The Amazonification of Uber: Part II
summary: Three years ago, I wrote about the Amazonification of Uber, an evolution of the transportation company into a closed business loop that feeds customers back into other Uber channels. At the time, the focus was on how Uber creates customer stickiness by, for example, actively cross-selling food delivery customers into grocery, and grocery into alcohol, and then alcohol back into mobility. Today, Uber appears to be moving beyond its focus on transportation and working to become a convenient super

headline: Cboe downgrade, Nubank revenue growth, Uber & Aurora
summary: Cboe Global Markets (CBOE) shares fall after Morgan Stanley analysts downgrade the stock to Underweight. Nu Holdings (NU) stock is in focus after Nubank reported revenue grew 40% in the first quarter. Uber (UBER) offers $1 billion of exchangeable bonds, convertible into shares of Aurora Innovation (AUR), which may dilute existing shareholders' stakes. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Uber bets on affordability with shared fixed-route rides, expanded passes
summary: The ride-sharing app has been looking to invest in more affordable transport and delivery offerings to widen its user base and combat slowing revenue growth in an uncertain economic environment.  Uber's new "Route Share" ride option will cost half as much as the company's UberX ride-hail service, by providing pickups every 20 minutes along busy commute corridors.  Initially available in cities such as New York, San Francisco and Chicago, Route Share will operate during weekday rush hours and Uber is considering partnering with employers to integrate pre-tax commuter benefits.

headline: 3 Warren Buffett-Type Stocks to Buy and Hold for Years
summary: The stocks listed here are all of profitable businesses with solid fundamentals.  Investing like Warren Buffett doesn't mean you have to copy his moves.  Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), Uber Technologies (NYSE: UBER), and Enbridge (NYSE: ENB) have tremendous businesses and while none of them are in Berkshire's portfolio today, here is why they could be excellent investments to consider loading up on right now.
